description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43517), it is essential to apply the respective updates based on your Windows version:

1. Download and install the appropriate KB updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 10 (64-bit and 32-bit): [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

2. Ensure that you restart your system after the installation process to make sure changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a heap-based buffer overflow that could allow for unauthorized remote code execution.
- Always ensure your system is fully backed up before applying updates, as unexpected issues can occur during the process.
